pages.title: Vault Catalysts
pages.text: $(#033dfc)Vault Catalysts$() are your primary way of adding Modifiers to Vaults.$(br)Each $(#033dfc)Catalyst$() may either roll static modifiers, or a random positive/negative/curse.$(br)Upon applying a modifier, that modifier will $(#033dfc)no longer be able to roll$().$(br)Upon application, all other $(#033dfc)Catalyst$() will reroll their modifiers.

pages.title: Obtaining
pages.text: $(#033dfc)Vault Catalysts$() are obtained through either crafting them with $(#033dfc)Catalyst Fragments$() & $(#033dfc)Vault Gems$(), rerolling $(#033dfc)pre-existing Catalysts$() or finding them inside $(#033dfc)Vault Chests$().$()If the $(#033dfc)Vault$() has been modified with $(#033dfc)Catalyst$(), $(#033dfc)Catalyst fragments$() will not be obtainable

pages.title: Usage
pages.text: $(#033dfc)Vault Catalysts$() can be used by applying them to $(#033dfc)Vault Crystals$() inside an anvil, or creating $(#033dfc)Vault Inhibitors$(), that do the exact opposite of $(#033dfc)Vault Catalysts$().$(br)Each $(#033dfc)Vault Catalyst$() has different modifiers that are differently weighted, some being more significant and rarer, others being more common and less impacting.

pages.title: Vault Inhibitors
pages.text: $(#033dfc)Vault Inhibitors$() are used to remove $(#033dfc)Vault Modifiers$() from Crystals. To obtain, combine a $(#033dfc)Vault Catalyst$() with a perfect echo gem inside an anvil, which will result in a Vault Inhibitor.$(br)Vault Inhibitors inherit the attributes of the $(#033dfc)Vault Catalyst$() and reverse it's effect. Each application has a chance to exhaust the Crystal.
